result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Bladorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes: Follow through with  AODA treatment/counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without valid prescription.. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with co-defendant.  Work to regain custody of minor child.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle M Bladorn

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Danielle M Bladorn in court, in custody, with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 5.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 5.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 5,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 6 dismissed and read in.  Case 13CM1679 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. Probation may be transferred to Jefferson County.
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No contact with codefendant.  Follow through with AODA treatement/counseling.  Work to regain custody of minor child.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney M Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Danielle M Bladorn did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody in Jefferson County Jail. Clerk to notify Jefferson County Jail of defendant's next Court date. If defendant does not have Huber Privileges defendant to be produced.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
